optionalfeature.name: Attack Refiner
entries: Your weapon makes minute recalibrations after every missed attack to ensure the next lands true. Your innovation gains the {@trait backswing} and {@trait shove} traits.

optionalfeature.name: Deadly Strike
entries: Through precise calculation, you've found the perfect shape for your weapon to deal extreme damage on a well-placed strike. Your innovation gains the {@trait deadly d8} trait. If your innovation was already deadly, it increases its {@trait deadly} die to {@damage d12} instead of gaining deadly {@damage d8}.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Damage
entries: You've made your innovation more powerful than other weapons of its kind. Increase your innovation's weapon damage die by one step ({@damage d4} to {@damage d6}, {@damage d6} to {@damage d8}, {@damage d8} to {@damage d10}, {@damage d10} to {@damage d12}). As normal, you can't increase your die by more than one size, so this modification isn't cumulative with complex simplicity.

optionalfeature.name: Extensible Weapon
entries: You've found a way to construct your weapon so that it can extend while leaving its balance unchanged. Your innovation gains the {@trait reach} trait. If the weapon already had the {@trait reach} trait, it increases your reach by an additional 10 feet, instead of the usual additional 5 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Impossible Alloy
entries: Other inventors claim it's not even technically possible, but you've managed to create several metal alloys that seem to work for only you. These alloys can damage opponents vulnerable to any one of the seven skymetals. Your innovation is treated as all seven skymetals (abysium, adamantine, djezet, inubrix, noqual, orichalcum, and siccatite). This means you deal more damage to a variety of creatures, though you don't apply any of the other special effects for weapons made of those skymetals.

optionalfeature.name: Momentum Retainer
entries: A special weighted device lets your weapon retain more of its momentum when you attack. Your innovation gains the {@trait forceful} and {@trait versatile B} traits.

optionalfeature.name: Omnirange Stabilizers
entries: You've modified your innovation to be dangerous and effective at any range. If your innovation had the {@trait volley} trait, remove the {@trait volley} trait. Otherwise, increase your innovation's range increment by 50 feet or an amount equal to the weapon's base range increment, whichever is more.

optionalfeature.name: Rune Capacity
entries: Whether you've dabbled with orichalcum or found another engineering solution, you've built your innovation in such a way that it can hold an additional property rune. Your innovation can have one more property rune than a normal item of its kind (to a maximum of four property runes with a {@item +3 weapon potency||+3 potency} weapon).

optionalfeature.name: Flight Chassis
entries: You fit your construct with a means of flight, such as adding rotors or rebuilding it with wings and a lightweight construction. Your innovation gains a fly Speed of 25 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Miracle Gears
entries: As you perfect your innovation's cortex, it becomes much more intelligent. Its Intelligence modifier increases by 2, and it learns a language of your choice from among the languages you know. Your construct gains the ability to use actions that require greater Intelligence, like {@action Coerce} and {@action Decipher Writing}. Finally, your construct becomes legendary in two Intelligence- or Charisma-based skills of your choice. You must have the marvelous gears modification to select this modification.

optionalfeature.name: Resistant Coating
entries: Your innovation is hard to damage by any means. It gains resistance 5 to all damage (except adamantine).

optionalfeature.name: Runic Keystone
entries: You've incorporated a device similar to a runestone into your innovation, allowing it to hold a property rune, even though it isn't a weapon or suit of armor. An armor property rune affects your innovation itself if it would affect the wearer of the armor. A weapon property rune grants whatever properties it would normally grant to a weapon to your innovation's unarmed attacks, following all the requirements as normal (for instance, a vorpal rune would only apply to slashing melee unarmed attacks); if the rune affects only ranged attacks, it has no effect unless your innovation has a built-in ranged attack (from the projectile launcher initial modification, for example). If the rune would affect the physical shape or appearance of the weapon or armor itself, like {@item glamered}, the rune has no effect when etched into your construct.

optionalfeature.name: Wall Configuration
entries: Your innovation can transform from a mobile construct to a stationary battlefield emplacement. It can unfold as a 2-action activity that has the {@trait manipulate} trait, changing from its usual form into a thin, straight wall of metal and gears up to 10 feet tall and 30 feet long. The wall must extend through your innovation's original space. While your construct is a wall, it can't take any actions except to use the same activity to transform back, and it can't defend itself easily, making it {@condition flat-footed} and giving it an additional –2 status penalty to its AC. The wall blocks line of sight and effect unless your innovation has half its maximum HP or fewer, at which point holes in the wall allow creatures to see through and attack with cover, and Tiny creatures to slip through.

optionalfeature.name: Automated Impediments
entries: Your armor uses electromagnetic fields, subharmonic distortions, or other techniques to make it difficult for those close to you to move unless you allow it. While wearing your armor, all spaces adjacent to you are {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for your enemies.

optionalfeature.name: Energy Barrier
entries: Your armor's defenses ablate any kind of energy coming your way. While wearing your armor, you gain resistance to all energy damage (acid, cold, electricity, fire, force, negative, positive, and sonic damage) equal to 2 + half your level. You must have the harmonic oscillator, metallic reactance, or phlogistonic regulator modification to select this modification.

optionalfeature.name: Incredible Resistance
entries: You've improved upon your breakthrough modification's ability to resist damage. Choose one of the following breakthrough modifications your innovation has: dense plating, layered mesh, or tensile absorption. Increase the resistance you gain from that modification to be equal to your level, instead of half your level.

optionalfeature.name: Multisensory Mask
entries: You've built a multisensory mask over your armor that protects you by distorting your figure from all senses, leaving behind only a hazy image, muffled sounds, and so forth. While wearing the armor, you gain {@condition concealed||concealment} against all creatures, even if they are using a nonvisual precise sense, such as a bat's echolocation. As normal for effects that leave your location obvious, you can't use this {@condition concealed||concealment} to {@action Hide} or {@action Sneak}. If you use a {@condition hostile} action, the {@condition concealed||concealment} ends until you restore the mask as a single action, which has the {@trait manipulate} trait.

optionalfeature.name: Perfect Fortification
entries: You've outfitted your armor with such heavy fortifications that deadly attacks often lose their edge. Each time you're critically hit while wearing the armor, attempt a DC {@flatDC 13} flat check. On a success, it becomes a normal hit. This isn't cumulative with fortification runes or other abilities that reduce critical hits with a flat check. Additionally, you gain resistance 2 + half your level against precision damage.

optionalfeature.name: Physical Protections
entries: Your armor has so many adjustments and precautions that it can guard against all physical damage. While wearing your armor, you gain resistance to all physical damage (bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, as well as persistent bleed damage) equal to half your level. You must have the dense plating, layered mesh, or tensile absorption breakthrough modification to select this modification.

optionalfeature.name: Rune Capacity
entries: Whether you've done some dabbling in orichalcum alloys or found another engineering solution, you've built your innovation in such a way that it can hold an additional property rune. Your innovation can have one more property rune than a normal item of its kind (to a maximum of four property runes with a {@item +3 armor potency||+3 potency} armor).

optionalfeature.name: Advanced Rangefinder
entries: A carefully tuned scope or targeting device makes your weapon especially good at hitting weak points. Your innovation gains the {@trait backstabber} trait and increases its range increment by 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Aerodynamic Construction
entries: You carefully engineer the shape of your weapon to maintain its momentum in attacks against successive targets. Your innovation gains the {@trait sweep} trait and the {@trait versatile S} trait

optionalfeature.name: Inconspicuous Appearance
entries: Your innovation is built for easy concealment and surprise attacks. It gains the backstabber and versatile P traits. If the weapon has light Bulk, it also gains the {@trait concealable} trait.

item: One-Handed Weapon Only; Can't Have the {@trait Two-Hand} Trait

optionalfeature.name: Integrated Gauntlet
entries: Combining your weapon with a gauntlet, you make it so you can quickly switch between attacking with your weapon and tinkering using your hands. Your innovation gains the {@trait free-hand} trait.

optionalfeature.name: Manifold Alloy
entries: You've devised several alloys that contain useful properties of various metals, and you replace a number of parts of your weapon or its ammunition with pieces from these alloys. Your weapon innovation is cold iron and silver. This means you deal more damage to a variety of supernatural creatures, such as demons, devils, and fey.

optionalfeature.name: Rope Shot
entries: Your weapon can shoot projectiles that split into simple ropes or nets around your foes' legs to trip your targets, and you can climb using the grappling hooks built into the weapon. Your weapon innovation gains the {@trait climbing} and {@trait ranged trip} traits.

optionalfeature.name: Tangle Line
entries: Your weapon has an extensible line that you can use to knock your enemies over and quickly recall the weapon back to your hand. Your innovation gains the {@trait ranged trip} trait and the {@trait tethered} trait.

optionalfeature.name: Advanced Weaponry
entries: You've powered up your construct's weaponry. Choose one of your construct's unarmed attacks to gain your choice of one initial weapon modification, chosen from the list of {@subclassFeature Innovation|Inventor|G&G|weapon|G&G|1|G&G|initial weapon modifications} or from other initial weapon modifications to which you have access. The unarmed attack must meet any requirements for the chosen traits (such as being a melee attack for entangling form), and since it's an unarmed attack, it can never meet certain requirements, such as being a simple weapon for complex simplicity.

optionalfeature.name: Antimagic Construction
entries: Whether you used some clever adaptation of the magic-negating skymetal known as noqual or created magical protections entirely of your own devising, you've made your innovation highly resilient to spells. Your construct innovation gains a +2 circumstance bonus to all saving throws and AC against spells.

optionalfeature.name: Climbing Limbs
entries: With appendages that can claw or create suction, your construct becomes a capable climber. Your innovation gains a climb Speed equal to half its land Speed.

optionalfeature.name: Durable Construction
entries: Your innovation is solidly built; it can take significant punishment before being destroyed. Increase its maximum HP by your level.

optionalfeature.name: Marvelous Gears
entries: Your innovation gains expert proficiency in {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Stealth}, and {@skill Survival}. For any of these skills in which it was already an expert (because of being an advanced construct companion, for example), it gains master proficiency instead. If you have the {@classFeature revolutionary innovation|Inventor|G&G|15} class feature, these proficiencies improve to master, or legendary if your construct innovation was already an expert. You must have the {@optfeature wonder gears|G&G} modification to select this modification.

optionalfeature.name: Turret Configuration
entries: Your innovation can transform from a mobile construct to a stationary turret. Your construct companion can transform as a single action, which has the {@trait manipulate} trait, turning into a turret in its space (or transforming back from a turret into its normal configuration). While it's a turret, your innovation is {@condition immobilized}, but the damage die from its projectile launcher increases to {@damage 1d6} and the range increment increases to 60 feet. You must have the {@optfeature projectile launcher|G&G} modification to select this modification.

optionalfeature.name: Antimagic Plating
entries: Whether you used some clever adaptation of the magic-negating skymetal known as noqual or created magical protections of your own design, you've strengthened your armor against magic. While wearing the armor, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to all saving throws against spells and to AC against spells. Against spells that target the armor directly (like {@spell heat metal|APG}), you instead gain a +4 circumstance bonus to all saving throws and to AC.

optionalfeature.name: Camouflage Pigmentation
entries: You've modified your armor's exterior to let you blend into your surroundings with ease, as long as you stay still. While wearing your armor, you can {@action Hide} even without cover or concealment, as the pigmentation shifts to match your surroundings.

optionalfeature.name: Dense Plating
entries: You have encased your armor in robust plating. While wearing your armor, you gain resistance to slashing damage equal to half your level.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Resistance
entries: You've improved upon your initial modification's ability to resist damage. The resistance from your initial armor modification adds your full level, instead of half your level (for instance, phlogistonic regulator's resistance would increase to your level). If you have more than one initial modification that gives resistance, choose which one this applies to.

optionalfeature.name: Heavy Construction
entries: You've expanded your innovation into a heavy bulwark, and your groundbreaking design ensures you don't take any of the drawbacks for such heavy defenses. Your innovation becomes heavy armor, and your proficiency in your innovation armor (but no other heavy armor) advances to be equal to your proficiency in medium armor. If your Strength score is at least 16, you remove the Speed penalty entirely instead of reducing it to –5 feet. The armor's adjusted statistics are: {@i AC Bonus} +5; {@i Dex Cap} +1; {@i Check Penalty} –2; {@i Speed Penalty} –10 feet; {@i Strength} 16; {@i Bulk} 3; {@i Group} {@group composite}; {@i Armor Traits} {@trait bulwark}}. {@note You can see the improved version of the armor {@item Heavy Power Suit|G&G|here}.}

optionalfeature.name: Hyper Boosters
entries: You've improved your speed boosters' power through a breakthrough that significantly increases the energy flow without risking exploding. You gain a +10-foot status bonus to your Speed, which increases to a +20-foot status bonus when you're in {@action Overdrive}. If you're legendary in {@skill Crafting}, it instead increases to a +30-foot status bonus when you're in {@action Overdrive}. You must have the speed boosters modification to select this modification.

optionalfeature.name: Layered Mesh
entries: You've woven an incredibly powerful network of interlocking mesh around your armor, which catches piercing attacks and diffuses them. While wearing your armor, you gain resistance to piercing damage equal to half your level.

optionalfeature.name: Tensile Absorption
entries: You've enhanced the tensile capabilities of your armor, enabling it to bend with bludgeoning attacks. While wearing your armor, you gain resistance to bludgeoning damage equal to half your level.

optionalfeature.name: Blunt Shot
entries: Your weapon innovation can file the edges off your ammunition and adjust the blunt force of the shot to deliver a bludgeoning attack when necessary, as well as to avoid striking a lethal blow with an otherwise deadly shot. Your innovation gains the {@trait nonlethal} and {@trait versatile B} traits. You can choose whether to apply the {@trait nonlethal} trait on each attack with your innovation.

optionalfeature.name: Complex Simplicity
entries: Increase your innovation's weapon damage die by one step ({@damage d4} to {@damage d6}, {@damage d6} to {@damage d8}, {@damage d8} to {@damage d10}, {@damage d10} to {@damage d12}). In addition, it gains one of the following traits of your choice: {@trait versatile B}, {@trait versatile P}, or {@trait versatile S}.

item: One-handed Melee Weapon Only; Can't Have the {@trait Agile}, {@trait Attached}, or {@trait Free-hand} Trait

optionalfeature.name: Dynamic Weighting
entries: Your weapon's modified weight distribution can increase power in exchange for taking more hands to wield. Your innovation gains the {@trait two-hand} trait, with a damage die one size higher than the weapon's normal weapon damage die size (for instance, a {@item longsword} would gain the {@trait two-hand d10} trait). Your innovation also gains the {@trait versatile B} trait.

optionalfeature.name: Entangling Form
entries: You've altered your weapon to including tangling wires or straps, or to have a flexible construction. Your innovation gains the {@trait grapple} and {@trait trip} traits.

optionalfeature.name: Hampering Spikes
entries: You've added long, snagging spikes to your weapon, which you can use to impede your foes' movement. Your innovation gains the {@trait hampering} and {@trait versatile P} traits.

optionalfeature.name: Hefty Composition
entries: Blunt surfaces and sturdy construction make your weapon hefty and mace-like. Your innovation gains the {@trait shove} and {@trait versatile B} traits.

optionalfeature.name: Modular Head
entries: You've constructed a multi-purpose, adjustable striking surface for your weapon, or you've made special ammunition you can swiftly alter. Your innovation gains the {@trait modular} trait for bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing. When you {@action Interact} to use the {@trait modular} trait, you can also choose to give the weapon the {@trait nonlethal} trait if it doesn't currently have it, or to remove that trait if it's currently {@trait nonlethal}.

optionalfeature.name: Pacification Tools
entries: Softer materials make your weapon suited to knock out instead of kill, and special protrusions let you catch weapons and disarm your foes. Your innovation gains the {@trait disarm} and {@trait nonlethal} traits. You can choose whether to apply the {@trait nonlethal} trait on each attack with your innovation.

optionalfeature.name: Razor Prongs
entries: You can knock down and slash your foes with sharp, curved blades added to your weapon. Your innovation gains the {@trait trip} and {@trait versatile S} traits.

optionalfeature.name: Segmented Frame
entries: Hinges, clamps, and telescoping parts make your innovation collapsible and adjustable. It gains the {@trait modular} trait for bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing. You can {@action Interact} to collapse the item down to light Bulk or to return it to your normal form. When it's collapsed to light Bulk, it has the {@trait concealable} trait, which grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Stealth} checks and DCs to hide or {@action Conceal an Object||conceal the weapon.}.

optionalfeature.name: Accelerated Mobility
entries: Actuated legs, efficient gears in the wheels or treads, or add-on boosters make your construct faster. Your innovation's Speed increases to 40 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Amphibious Construction
entries: Increased buoyancy, rudders, and a means of propulsion like a fluked tail or powerful propeller make your construct able to travel in water. Your innovation gains a swim Speed of 25 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Increased Size
entries: You built your construct innovation bigger than most. Your construct is {@trait Large}. If you have this modification and your construct innovation becomes an advanced construct companion or otherwise gains the ability to become {@trait Large}, you can immediately change increased size to a different initial construct modification.

optionalfeature.name: Manual Dexterity
entries: Your construct innovation has articulated hands or similar appendages with significant manual dexterity. It can perform {@trait manipulate} actions with up to two of its limbs. As normal for a companion, it still can't wield weapons or held items that don't have the {@trait companion} trait, and it can't {@action Activate an Item||activate items}.

optionalfeature.name: Projectile Launcher
entries: Your construct has a mounted dart launcher, embedded cannon, or similar armament. Your innovation gains a ranged unarmed attack that deals {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning or piercing damage (you choose when you pick this modification). The attack has the {@trait propulsive} trait and a range increment of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Sensory Array
entries: Additional sensory devices give your innovation {@ability low-light vision} and {@ability darkvision}, as well as imprecise {@ability tremorsense} out to a range of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Wonder Gears
entries: You map specialized skills into your construct's crude intelligence. Your innovation becomes trained in {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Stealth}, and {@skill Survival}.

optionalfeature.name: Harmonic Oscillator
entries: You designed your armor to inaudibly thrum at just the right frequency to create interference against force and sound waves. You gain resistance equal to 3 + half your level to force and sonic damage. When under the effects of {@action Overdrive|G&G}, the resistance increases by 2.

optionalfeature.name: Metallic Reactance
entries: The metals in your armor are carefully alloyed to ground electricity and protect from acidic chemical reactions. You gain resistance equal to 3 + half your level to acid and electricity damage. When under the effects of {@action Overdrive|G&G}, the resistance increases by 2.

optionalfeature.name: Muscular Exoskeleton
entries: Your armor supports your muscles with a carefully crafted exoskeleton. When you send your armor into overdrive, the exoskeleton supplements your feats of athletics as well. When under the effects of {@action Overdrive|G&G}, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to {@skill Athletics} checks; if you're a master in {@skill Crafting}, this increases to a +2 circumstance bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Otherworldly Protection
entries: Just because you use science doesn't mean you can't build your armor with carefully chosen materials and gizmos designed to protect against otherworldly attacks. You gain resistance equal to 3 + half your level to negative damage, or to positive damage if you have negative healing (such as if you're a dhampir). You gain the same amount of resistance to any types of alignment damage—good, evil, chaotic, lawful—that can damage you (note that creatures don't take a given type of alignment damage unless they are of the opposing alignment; for instance, you can take evil damage only if you are good in alignment).

optionalfeature.name: Phlogistonic Regulator
entries: A layer of insulation within your armor protects you from rapid temperature fluctuations. You gain resistance equal to half your level to cold and fire damage. When under the effects of {@action Overdrive|G&G}, the resistance increases by 2.

optionalfeature.name: Speed Boosters
entries: You have boosters in your armor that increase your Speed. You gain a +5-foot status bonus to your Speed, which increases to a +10-foot status bonus when under the effects of {@action Overdrive|G&G}.

optionalfeature.name: Subtle Dampeners
entries: You've designed your armor to help you blend in and dampen noise slightly. When you send your armor into overdrive, the dampeners increase their effect, improving your {@skill Stealth}. When under the effects of {@action Overdrive|G&G}, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to {@skill Stealth} checks. If you're a master in {@skill Crafting}, this increases to a +2 circumstance bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Lesson of Dreams
entries: You gain the {@spell veil of dreams|APG} hex, and your familiar learns {@spell sleep}.

optionalfeature.name: Lesson of the Elements
entries: You gain the {@spell elemental betrayal|APG} hex. Your familiar learns your choice of {@spell burning hands}, {@spell air bubble}, {@spell hydraulic push}, or {@spell pummeling rubble|APG}.

optionalfeature.name: Lesson of Life
entries: You gain the {@spell life boost|APG} hex, and your familiar learns {@spell spirit link}.

optionalfeature.name: Lesson of Protection
entries: You gain the {@spell blood ward|APG} hex, and your familiar learns {@spell mage armor}.

optionalfeature.name: Lesson of Vengeance
entries: You gain the {@spell needle of vengeance|APG} hex, and your familiar learns {@spell phantom pain}.

optionalfeature.name: Lesson of Mischief
entries: You gain the {@spell deceiver's cloak|APG} hex, and your familiar learns {@spell mad monkeys|APG}.

optionalfeature.name: Lesson of Shadow
entries: You gain the {@spell malicious shadow|APG} hex, and your familiar learns {@spell chilling darkness}.

optionalfeature.name: Lesson of Snow
entries: You gain the {@spell personal blizzard|APG} hex, and your familiar learns {@spell wall of wind}.

optionalfeature.name: Lesson of Death
entries: You gain the {@spell curse of death|APG} hex, and your familiar learns {@spell raise dead}.

optionalfeature.name: Lesson of Renewal
entries: You gain the {@spell restorative moment|APG} hex, and your familiar learns {@spell field of life}.

optionalfeature.name: Lesson of Calamity
entries: You gain the {@spell stumbling curse|sot1} hex, and your familiar learns {@spell ill omen|logm}.

optionalfeature.name: Lesson of the Frozen Queen
entries: You gain the {@spell glacial heart|lol} hex, and your familiar learns {@spell wall of ice}.

optionalfeature.name: Lesson of Favors
entries: {@note A witch with the {@class witch|apg|pacts|pacts|DA} patron can select the lesson of favors when a feat or other effect grants a greater lesson. The GM might determine that other witches who find themselves dealing primarily in favors can uncover this lesson, as well.}
You gain the {@spell return the favor|DA} hex, and your familiar learns {@spell mind of menace|SoM}.

optionalfeature.name: Lesson of Bargains
entries: {@note A witch with the {@class witch|apg|pacts|pacts|DA} patron can select the lesson of bargains when a feat or other effect grants a major lesson. The GM might determine that other witches who find themselves making bargains and holding double-crossers accountable can uncover this lesson, as well.}
You gain the {@spell over the coals|DA} hex, and your familiar learns {@spell subconscious suggestion}.
